data.title: shoot off, v. — Green’s Dictionary of Slang
data.text:
S. Crane in N.Y. Press 9 Dec. in Stallman (1966) 113: Say, young feller, if yeh go shootin’ off yer face at me, I’ll wipe d’ joint wid yeh. W.C. Gore Student Sl. in Cohen (1997) 15: shoot with the face To talk. C. M’Govern Sarjint Larry an’ Frinds 131: Every toime Oi comes to Mainly an’ hears Americans shootin’ off deir faces about wot’s to become of the de Philipeens. S.F. Call 21 May 5/2: Egghead was just shooting off his face. P. & T. Casey Gay-cat 263: Me, I ain’t shootin’ off my face [...] until yer tells me all the latest news about Strong-arm. Black Mask Aug. III 106: Jack had been shooting off his face about Spanish history and treasures. Truth (Brisbane) 4 Apr. 16/4: The debate on the Address is notoriously the occasion for all the bores [...] to ‘shoot off their face’ as the American slang has it. (con. 1900s) S. Lewis Elmer Gantry 107: Glad to see there’s one galoot here that’s got sense enough to stick by the Old Book [...] ’stead of shooting off his face like some Pseudo-Baptist. ‘Max Brand’ Pleasant Jim 50: Doggone me, Jim, if it ain’t a shame the way these kids will shoot off their faces! J.T. Farrell Gas-House McGinty 331: They’re like all punks. They don’t know nothin’ about life so they shoot their faces off big. Hecht & Fowler Great Magoo 71: Dat cheap squoit shootin’ off his face! J.H. O’Hara Pal Joey 9: Right off you shoot off your face about how I wrote you. W. Pegler George Spelvin Chats 75: That old lady of yours is going to give you plenty of headaches shooting off her face. J. Steinbeck Sweet Thursday (1955) 111: She loves to shoot off her face.

Rocky Mountain News 3 Aug. n.p.: A Dutch married woman [...] was taxed $17.80 for ‘shooting off her mouth’ against the virtue and morality of a neighbouring maiden [R]. St Louis Globe-Democrat 19 Jan. n.p.: These classical observations move the barkeeper to inquire what they are ‘shooting off their mouths about, then?’. Chicago Trib. 7 Apr. 3/1: Don’t ’shoot off your lip’ — you’ve got too much cheek. Ally Sloper’s Half Holiday 31 May 35/2: Ally, ole hoss, you bin a-foolin’ round this claim fur might near a year, an’ hev never yit shot off your mouth on the marrying biz. F. Francis Jr Saddle and Mocassin 136: If he could kill Indians shooting off his mouth at them, he’d soon clean out all there is. S. Crane Maggie, a Girl of the Streets (2001) 41: Youse fellers er lookin’ fer a scrap an’ it’s damn likely yeh’ll fin’ one if yeh keeps on shootin’ off yer mout’s. W.M. Raine Bucky O’Connor (1910) 23: Seems to me you shot off your mouth more than you did that big gun of yours, Mr. Sheriff. Bulletin (Sydney) 13 Aug. 11/4: The German Kaiser has never shot off anything more dangerous than his mouth since his reign commenced. T. Burke Limehouse Nights 235: ’Enery – if yeh don’t stop shootin’ yeh mouth at me, I’ll push yeh blasted face in! S. Lewis Babbitt (1974) 68: I’d like to take one fellow I know in school that’s always shooting his mouth off, and catch him alone—. Chicago Trib. 13 Nov. N4/1: Mussolini [...] figures that a man can do as much harm by shooting off his bazoo as he can by shooting off a Roscoe [...] How can they put a man in the ice box for shooting off his kisser. C. McKay Home to Harlem 22: Don’t go shooting off your mouth too free. W.R. Burnett Iron Man 230: I couldn’t stand for you shooting your mouth off that way. W. Smith Bessie Cotter 228: Shooting off his bazoo like he owned the dump. D. Runyon ‘Social Error’ in Runyon on Broadway (1954) 448: Sitting around shooting off his mouth, and putting himself away as a tough guy. Indiana Gaz. (PA) 11 Sept. 3/1: He said that after he got onto himself, he stopped shooting off his bazoo about his tolerance. C. McCullers Heart is a Lonely Hunter (1986) 124: He came in that night and started drinking, and when he was drunk he shot off his mouth about you. Times-Herald (Port Huron, MI) 1 Apr. 4/1: The chap who’s always shooting off his yap about his deeds [...] of long ago. J. Evans Halo in Blood (1988) 87: You come busting in here and shoot off your bazoo at me and tell me if I don’t like it I can go to hell. News leader (Staunton, VA) 31 July 4/3: He will not be run off the ball field for shooting off his kisser. Goldin et al. DAUL 192/1: Shoot one’s bazoo (or kisser) off. [...] Shoot one’s mouth off. [...] Shoot one’s yap off. To talk indiscreetly or belligerently; to inform authorities. B. Spicer Blues for the Prince (1989) 32: That’s because I don’t shoot off my yap so much. (con. 1944) Wilder & Blum Stalag 17 [film script] 105: I had to be the ham! I had to shoot off my mouth! ‘Ed Lacy’ Lead With Your Left (1958) 19: ‘You shoot your gums off too,’ Wales said dryly. [...] ‘you told me the bonds were missing.’. Indianapolis Star (IN) 31 Dec. 6/2: Medina, the old bore who goes around [...] shooting off his bazoo about his great courage. ‘Ed Lacy’ Freeloaders 183: I sure shoot off my yap too much. J. Mills Panic in Needle Park (1971) 39: If anyone murders me it’ll be because you’re shooting off your big mouth. N. Cohn Awopbop. (1970) 67: His willingness to be outrageous, to shoot his mouth off. D. Ireland Glass Canoe (1982) 48: The stranger [...] saw the justice of Bob being allowed to shoot his mouth off because of his grief. L. Mantell Murder and Chips 55: There I go again. I promised myself I’d keep my trap shut [...] But I have to shoot my mouth off. Can’t seem to help it. J. Ellroy Brown’s Requiem 43: You go around shooting off your mouth and everybody knows your plans. M.B. ‘Chopper’ Read Chopper From The Inside 105: Mick [...] has the sense not to shoot his mouth off. R.C. Cruz Straight Outta Compton 17: Shootin’ off his fat lip. Running off at the mouth. Indep. Rev. 22 Jan. 3: That idiot from Cork shooting his mouth off etc. Hartford Courant (CT) 11 Aug. 20/2: The chief of the Dallas NAACP is forced out after shooting off his yap with a snide denigration of the Jewish people. G.V. Higgins At End of Day (2001) 163: One of them, Sean McGray, shot off his mouth — so he’s the next one to go. J.J. DeCeglie Drawing Dead [ebook] I’d shot my mouth off just that little bit too much.
